page.title: 14CHILDRENS RHYMES,S.LEEDS
page.content: The children at Bewerley Street Primary School told their teacher about {DIPPING GAMES}:rhymes used to decide who is going to be the chaser in their playground games. The person saying the rhyme points to each child in turn and the person pointed to on the last word is "on". 1.One potato,two potato,three potato, four,five potato,six potato,seven potato ,more. 2.Eeny meeny maker acker air ra chicker pocker lollipoper om pom push and you do not have it.(rhyme repeated until only one child left.They are on) 3.Dip dip do,the cats got flu.The dogs got chickenpox and out goes you. 4.Dip dip dip,my blue ship. Sailing on the water like a cup and saucer, you are it. We have found that all these rhymes are remembered by our parents.
